trans-unit.source: Bayesian Linear Regression
trans-unit.target: Bayesian Linear Regression

trans-unit.source: Creates a Bayesian linear regression model
trans-unit.target: Creates a Bayesian linear regression model

trans-unit.source: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="97F9510F-60BA-4D78-8A33-3078A6C7F260" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Initialize Model / Regression</legacyLink>
trans-unit.target: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="97F9510F-60BA-4D78-8A33-3078A6C7F260" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Initialize Model / Regression</legacyLink>

trans-unit.source: Module Overview
trans-unit.target: Module Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Bayesian Linear Regression</ui> module to create a regression model based on Bayesian statistics.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Bayesian Linear Regression</ui> module to create a regression model based on Bayesian statistics.

trans-unit.source: After you have configured the model, you must train the model using a tagged dataset and the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.
trans-unit.target: After you have configured the model, you must train the model using a tagged dataset and the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.

trans-unit.source: The trained model can then be used to make predictions.
trans-unit.target: The trained model can then be used to make predictions.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, the untrained model can be passed to <link xlink:href="75fb875d-6b86-4d46-8bcc-74261ade5826" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Cross Validate Model</link> for cross-validation against a labeled data set.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, the untrained model can be passed to <link xlink:href="75fb875d-6b86-4d46-8bcc-74261ade5826" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Cross Validate Model</link> for cross-validation against a labeled data set.

trans-unit.source: Understanding Bayesian Regression
trans-unit.target: Understanding Bayesian Regression

trans-unit.source: In statistics, the <newTerm>Bayesian</newTerm> approach to regression is often contrasted with the <newTerm>frequentist</newTerm> approach.
trans-unit.target: In statistics, the <newTerm>Bayesian</newTerm> approach to regression is often contrasted with the <newTerm>frequentist</newTerm> approach.

trans-unit.source: The Bayesian approach uses linear regression supplemented by additional information in the form of a prior probability distribution.
trans-unit.target: The Bayesian approach uses linear regression supplemented by additional information in the form of a prior probability distribution.

trans-unit.source: Prior information about the parameters is combined with a likelihood function to generate estimates for the parameters.
trans-unit.target: Prior information about the parameters is combined with a likelihood function to generate estimates for the parameters.

trans-unit.source: In contrast, the frequentist approach, represented by standard least-square linear regression, assumes that the data contains sufficient measurements to create a meaningful model.
trans-unit.target: In contrast, the frequentist approach, represented by standard least-square linear regression, assumes that the data contains sufficient measurements to create a meaningful model.

trans-unit.source: How to Configure a Bayesian Regression Model
trans-unit.target: How to Configure a Bayesian Regression Model

trans-unit.source: Add the <ui>Bayesian Linear Regression</ui> model to your experiment.
trans-unit.target: Add the <ui>Bayesian Linear Regression</ui> model to your experiment.

trans-unit.source: Add a training dataset containing a tagged (label) column with numerical values.
trans-unit.target: Add a training dataset containing a tagged (label) column with numerical values.

trans-unit.source: Set other parameters that affect the behavior of the regression model.
trans-unit.target: Set other parameters that affect the behavior of the regression model.

trans-unit.source: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section for details.
trans-unit.target: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section for details.

trans-unit.source: Add the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Module</link> or <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link> module.
trans-unit.target: Add the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Module</link> or <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link> module.

trans-unit.source: Run the experiment.
trans-unit.target: Run the experiment.

trans-unit.source: The module returns a trained model that you can use to make predictions.
trans-unit.target: The module returns a trained model that you can use to make predictions.

trans-unit.source: Or, you can right-click the output of the module and select <ui>Save as trained model</ui> to re-use the trained model in another experiment.
trans-unit.target: Or, you can right-click the output of the module and select <ui>Save as trained model</ui> to re-use the trained model in another experiment.

trans-unit.source: Options
trans-unit.target: Options

trans-unit.source: You can customize the model by using these parameters:
trans-unit.target: You can customize the model by using these parameters:

trans-unit.source: Regularization weight
trans-unit.target: Regularization weight

trans-unit.source: Specify a value to use for regularization.
trans-unit.target: Specify a value to use for regularization.

trans-unit.source: Regularization is used to prevent overfitting.
trans-unit.target: Regularization is used to prevent overfitting.

trans-unit.source: Allow unknown categorical levels
trans-unit.target: Allow unknown categorical levels

trans-unit.source: When this option is selected, the model will create a grouping for Unknown values.
trans-unit.target: When this option is selected, the model will create a grouping for Unknown values.

trans-unit.source: If you deselect it, the model can accept only the values contained in the training data.
trans-unit.target: If you deselect it, the model can accept only the values contained in the training data.

trans-unit.source: In the former case, the model might be less precise on known values but provide better predictions for new (unknown) values.
trans-unit.target: In the former case, the model might be less precise on known values but provide better predictions for new (unknown) values.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: For examples of regression models, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: For examples of regression models, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Compare Regression Models sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525731</linkUri></externalLink> contrasts several different kinds of regression models.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Compare Regression Models sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525731</linkUri></externalLink> contrasts several different kinds of regression models.

trans-unit.source: Regularization weight
trans-unit.target: Regularization weight

trans-unit.source: >=double.Epsilon
trans-unit.target: >=double.Epsilon

trans-unit.source: Float
trans-unit.target: Float

trans-unit.source: Type a constant to use in regularization.
trans-unit.target: Type a constant to use in regularization.

trans-unit.source: The constant represents the ratio of the precision of weight prior to the precision of noise.
trans-unit.target: The constant represents the ratio of the precision of weight prior to the precision of noise.

trans-unit.source: Allow unknown categorical levels
trans-unit.target: Allow unknown categorical levels

trans-unit.source: Any
trans-unit.target: Any

trans-unit.source: Boolean
trans-unit.target: Boolean

trans-unit.source: true
trans-unit.target: true

trans-unit.source: If true creates an additional level for each categorical column.
trans-unit.target: If true creates an additional level for each categorical column.

trans-unit.source: Any levels in the test dataset not available in the training dataset are mapped to this additional level.
trans-unit.target: Any levels in the test dataset not available in the training dataset are mapped to this additional level.
